input.old_string:
/**
 * Discord Webhook Notification Hook
 *
 * Thin adapter that converts platform-neutral notifications into Discord embeds.
 * Supports two modes:
 *   1. Regular channel: CLAUDE_DISCORD_WEBHOOK_URL â€” traditional embed posts
 *   2. Forum channel: CLAUDE_DISCORD_FORUM_WEBHOOK_URL â€” session-scoped threads
 *
 * When forum webhook is configured, SessionStart creates a new thread and
 * subsequent events (Stop/Notification) post into that thread.
 *
 * Note: PermissionRequest events are NOT triggered â€” permission notifications
 * come via Notification(permission_prompt), which only fires when the user
 * actually sees the prompt (not auto-approved).
 *
 * @see https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/webhook
 */
input.new_string:
/**
 * Discord Webhook Notification Hook
 *
 * Thin adapter that converts platform-neutral notifications into Discord embeds.
 * Supports two modes:
 *   1. Regular channel: CLAUDE_DISCORD_WEBHOOK_URL â€” traditional embed posts
 *   2. Forum channel: CLAUDE_DISCORD_FORUM_WEBHOOK_URL â€” session-scoped threads
 *
 * When forum webhook is configured, the thread is created lazily on the first
 * UserPromptSubmit (not on SessionStart) to avoid spurious threads from /clear.
 * Subsequent events (Stop/Notification) post into that thread.
 *
 * Note: PermissionRequest events are NOT triggered â€” permission notifications
 * come via Notification(permission_prompt), which only fires when the user
 * actually sees the prompt (not auto-approved).
 *
 * @see https://discord.com/developers/docs/resources/webhook
 */

git add home/dot_claude/hooks/implementations/discord-notification.ts && git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
fix(discord): defer forum thread creation to first UserPromptSubmit

Previously SessionStart always created a Discord forum thread, causing
spurious threads whenever /clear was used â€” even if no prompt was sent.

Thread creation is now lazy: the forum thread is created on the first
UserPromptSubmit for a session. SessionStart is now a no-op. Subsequent
Stop/Notification events post into the existing thread as before, with
a fallback that creates the thread if UserPromptSubmit was somehow missed.

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"

input.command:
git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
fix(discord): defer forum thread creation to first UserPromptSubmit

Previously SessionStart always created a Discord forum thread, causing
spurious threads whenever /clear was used â€” even if no prompt was sent.

Thread creation is now lazy: the forum thread is created on the first
UserPromptSubmit for a session. SessionStart is now a no-op. Subsequent
Stop/Notification events post into the existing thread as before, with
a fallback that creates the thread if UserPromptSubmit was somehow missed.

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"

input.command:
git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
fix(discord): defer forum thread creation to first UserPromptSubmit

Previously SessionStart always created a Discord forum thread, causing
spurious threads whenever /clear was used â€” even if no prompt was sent.

Thread creation is now lazy: the forum thread is created on the first
UserPromptSubmit for a session. SessionStart is now a no-op. Subsequent
Stop/Notification events post into the existing thread as before, with
a fallback that creates the thread if UserPromptSubmit was somehow missed.
